sentences.en: Consumers have become increasingly more discriminating in regard to quality.
sentences.cn: 消费者对质量的要求也更高.

sentences.en: Council officers were yesterday accused of discriminating against the disabled.
sentences.cn: 理事会的官员昨天以歧视残疾人为由被指控.

sentences.en: Diagnostics is a word of Greece origin , which means discriminating, specifying.
sentences.cn: 诊断学(diagnostics)一词源于希腊文,意指鉴别 、 确定.

sentences.en: Due caution should be exercised in discriminating between the two.
sentences.cn: 在区别这两者时应该相当谨慎.

sentences.en: He is incapable of discriminating between a good idea and a terrible one.
He told me to say many thingsall so delicate, so discriminating.
sentences.cn: 他要我说的话多着呢--都是很微妙很有见识的话.

sentences.en: Its definitions, generally sound and often discriminating, are at times truly Johnsonian.
sentences.cn: 它的定义是通常的发音并经常是有识别力的, 却有时真的是约翰逊流派的.

sentences.en: Many businesses are accused of discriminating against women.
sentences.cn: 许多企业被控有歧视妇女的做法.

sentences.en: Meanwhile, romantic Venus narrows our focus as she steps into discriminating Virgo.
sentences.cn: 同时, 浪漫的金星缩小了我们的焦点,因为它在有识别力的处女座.

sentences.en: More discriminating visitors now tend to shun the area.
sentences.cn: 更有鉴别力的游客现在往往避开该地区。

sentences.en: She has an artist's discriminating eye.
sentences.cn: 她具有艺术家特有的敏锐眼光.

sentences.en: She said, " He a lightly discriminating man. "
sentences.cn: “ 她说, \ ” 他是个很爱挑剔的买主.

sentences.en: These methods are not ranked order of their discriminating or quantitating ability.
sentences.cn: 这些方法不是按其鉴别和测定能力排列的.

sentences.en: They said the insurance companies were discriminating against the homeless.
sentences.cn: 他们说保险公司歧视无家可归的人.

sentences.en: Why're you discriminating against me, sir?
sentences.cn: 你干吗要跟我过不去呢, 长官?

words.tran_cn: 区别的，歧视的；有识别力的
有辨识力的；差别对待的
识别的；有差别的；有识别力的

trans.tran_cn: 有鉴别能力的，有识别能力的
trans.tran_en: able to judge what is of good quality and what is not

trans.tran_cn: 分别，辨别，区分( discriminate的现在分词 )，歧视，有差别地对待
